history.text: Movies based on WWII always seem to be pretty good.
I agree and this one tells a story I never heard before
Yeah. I didn't know much about Alan Turing before the movie. I didn't realize he played such an important role in world history.
Benedict cumberbatch is good in all his movies so I would like to see this
Yeah everyone seems to say he did a really good job.
I do wonder why it's considered an American historical drama when it's based on a British person.
I like how the one critic is surprised that a Hollywood movie exaggerated some things. Like what a shock!
I guess because it was made in America?
I think they have to exaggerate to make it interesting enough to keep people in seats for two or more hours.
Yeah exactly. To keep it interesting.
I guess I was questioning how they made it sound like it's American history.
So it's also kind of sort of a love story.
Now I'm even more curious after reading about his crush.
That is how they made it sound. I was thinking the same thing.
The enigma machine sounds dreadful and exciting. I assume that wrote the codes for them.
Anything called an Enigma machine has to be pretty cool. Even if it's Nazis who are using it.
I didn't realize Britain declared war in 1939. I thought it all started officially a little later. I wonder how he was invited to the team.
He sounds like he was analytical and very intelligent.
He was extremely smart. Not so great with people, it seems though.
Is that Rotten Tomatoes score a good thing or bad? It's a high number but so are the others.
That's a really good score.
I usually watch movies with a score of about 35% haha
I can't imagine him having to hide being gay in those times. It's great he found someone to marry.
That's crazy that he figured out not to decode every message knowing that the Germans would know. War is so much more than bloodshed.
This part seems very disappointing. I hope a lot more happens than what sounds like in this summary.

It's getting super involved. Turing lived a very comp
licated life.
It's a shame he had to send his wife away and hurt her. I wonder why they would have to destroy their work if it helped the cause so much?
That's what I'm wondering. It seems like there is a lot missing from that part of the summary.
I hope there is more to it. This sounds so interesting and I'd love to watch it.
Or I guess they already completed their work and they did't want it getting in the hands of their enemy?
It says the war ended so Nazis had to be defeated. I would think they would want to develop it more. Maybe Menzies was worried it would compromise his own work.
And yeah. What happens to Clarke? Do Turing and Clarke find happiness together? Does he live his true life at some point?
It doesn't say. I'm curious about that too. We saw earlier it talks about him being questioned by police but no mention of her there.
Yeah I don't know. This Menzies guy is bad news.
Oh yeah. That was 1951. After all of this.
I wonder what it means by Germans resetting Enigma each day. I'm very curious about that machine.
The machine needs it's own standalone movie lol
Is MI6 British? I wonder how the Soviet spy helped in the war.
Yeah MI6 is British.
I am wondering why Menzies threatened Clarke too. They don't elaborate on that and I hope it's in the movie.
The Soviets are on the British side, at least eventually. I guess at this point they were still considered enemies.
Do the people he worked with know he named his machine Christopher?
Yeah. Menzies just pops up, there's not enough detail. Definitely need to watch the movie
The machine he created is amazing.
I don't know. I would think they would know that. The other people helped him with the machine.
They just probably didn't know why he named it Christopher.
I wonder if Clarke ever found out the truth about being threatened.
I also wonder if he ever saw any of the other cryptographers. Who were they and why not mentioned much?
Why was he telling the policemen about his work?
Did they see something odd?
Or no. Was his machine stolen?
We need to know more about Clarke.
Maybe he was lonely and wanted his story out. Maybe he thought the break in was related to his earlier work?
Or I guess it's a good plot point to get the movie started.
I wonder what happened to make Turing confront Carincross. It could have had something to do with that.
I don't know. Probably once he found out he was a Soviet. He felt threatened that his work would fall into thr wrong hands.

uid1response.feedback: This was very interesting. Thank you.
